```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

# Load libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(rgeos)
library(rnaturalearth)
library(rnaturalearthdata)
library(sf)
library(spData)
library(spDataLarge)
library(tmap)
```

## Load and manipulate data
```{r}
# Load coffee dataset
coffee <- coffee_data %>% 
  mutate()

# Convert `ne_countries()` to class `sf` - maybe not necessary
sf_countries <- ne_countries(returnclass = 'sf')

# Merge `coffee` with `world` datasets (cannot merge world into coffee)
sf_coffee <- left_join(x = world, y = coffee, by = "name_long")
```

## Create Basic Plots
```{r}
# Plotting two attributes (columns) with `plot()`
plot(sf_coffee[c("coffee_production_2016", "coffee_production_2017")])

# Plotting one attribute (column) with `plot()`
plot(sf_coffee["coffee_production_2016"])
```

```{r}
# Plotting one attribute with `tm_shape()`
tm_shape(sf_coffee) +
  tm_polygons(col = "coffee_production_2016", # `tm_polygons()` replaces `tm_shape() + tm_borders()` combo
          title = "Coffee Production in 2016") +
  tm_polygons()
```

```{r}
# Plotting one attribute with `tm_shape()`
tm_coffee_2016 <- tm_shape(sf_coffee) +
  tm_borders() +
  tm_fill("coffee_production_2016")

tm_coffee_2017 <- tm_shape(sf_coffee) +
  tm_borders() +
  tm_fill("coffee_production_2017")

tmap_arrange(tm_coffee_2016, tm_coffee_2017)
```
